grammarNote.title: Topic and Copula: は and だ
grammarNote.explanation:
は picks up something already visible and comments on it. あの人はだれ？ — pointing at someone in view, asking about them.

だ declares what something is: フローレンだ！ — identifying the figure.

Notice the shift from が to は: 山がある (a mountain appears) vs. いい山だ (that mountain — now established — is nice). が introduces, は comments.

Watch for は and だ in every line. Which sentences introduce and which ones comment?
